summary: The "Nationally Enhancing the Well-being of Babies through Outreach and Research Now Act" (NEWBORN Act) authorizes funding for infant mortality pilot programs in areas with high infant mortality rates. These programs, administered by the Secretary of Health, award grants to eligible entities like health departments to develop community-specific plans, provide outreach to at-risk mothers, and improve access to health services. The bill prioritizes programs addressing specific health concerns and requires annual reports. It also authorizes $10 million for each fiscal year from 2025-2029.
